info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 01 at 9:08PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Callahan and northeastern Coleman Counties through 1000 PM CDT... At 908 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Oplin, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Cross Plains, Rowden, Oplin, Lake Coleman and Us- 283 Near The Coleman-Callahan County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for west central Texas.
